Text: Ayakapı (Turkish: ""The Gate of the Saint", "The holy gate"" ) (the toponym comes from the Turkish word "Aya", derived from pronunciation of the Greek word ἁγἰα, mean.

<Text: Ayakapı:  During the Byzantine era, it was named ta Dexiokratiana or ta Dexiokratous in Greek, after the houses owned here by a certain Dexiokrates.>
Triplets:< Ayakapı
5:
--------------------
Text: Ayakapı:  Its modern name comes from a church dedicated to Saint Theodosia which, according to Petrus Gillius, stood near the gate.

Triplets:<Ayakapia
6:
--------------------
Text: Ayakapı:  In Ayakapı lies one of the most important surviving Byzantine buildings of the historical peninsula, the Gül Mosque.
Triplets:<Ayakapı
8:
--------------------
Text: Ayakapı:  This structure is currently used as a storage for timber.
